pageContext.claim: “Why did the W.H.O. Ignore an email from Taiwanese health officials in late December alerting them to the possibility that CoronaVirus could be transmitted between humans?”
pageContext.analysis: This is deeply misleading. Chinese officials on Dec. 31, 2019, reported 27 cases of "unexplained pneumonia" in Wuhan. Taiwanese health officials sent an email to the WHO noting those same reports from Wuhan. The Taiwanese officials' email did not explicitly warn of human transmission. It read: "News resources today indicate that at least seven atypical pneumonia cases were reported in Wuhan, CHINA. Their health authorities replied to the media that the cases were believed not SARS; however the samples are still under examination, and cases have been isolated for treatment." The WHO did not ignore these reports, as Trump claimed. WHO officials requested more information from China the next day, Jan. 1.
